Differential Equations | Series Solutions at Ordinary Points -- Theorem

A recursion for the coefficients in the series solution of\n[imath]\begin{array}{c}\n\left(1+\alpha\left(\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{x}_{0}\right)^{2}\right) \mathrm{y}^{\prime \prime}+\beta\left(\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{x}_{0}\right) \mathrm{y}^{\prime}+\gamma \mathrm{y}=0 \\\n\mathrm{y}=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \mathrm{a}_{\mathrm{n}} \mathrm{x}^{\mathrm{n}}\n\end{array}[/imath][imath]\left(1+\alpha\left(\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{x}_{0}\right)^{2}\right) \mathrm{y}^{\prime \prime}+\beta\left(\mathrm{x}-\mathrm{x}_{0}\right) \mathrm{y}^{\prime}+\gamma \mathrm{y}=0 [/imath] [imath]\mathrm{y}=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \mathrm{a}_{\mathrm{n}} \mathrm{x}^{\mathrm{n}}[/imath]
